      • getLanguages

        public static java.util.Locale[] getLanguages()

        Returns:
        an array of Locale objects.

      • getSystemLocale

        public static java.util.Locale getSystemLocale()
        Gets the current value of the default locale for this instance of the Java Virtual Machine.

        The Java Virtual Machine sets the default locale during startup based on the host environment. This method must be used before

        Locale.setDefault(java.util.Locale)
        method is ever called.
        Returns:
        the default locale for this instance of the Java Virtual Machine.

        Returns:
        a BufferedImage object, or null.

      • byteCountToDisplaySize

        public static java.lang.String byteCountToDisplaySize(long size)

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        a human-readable display value (includes units).

      • startWithProtocol

        public static boolean startWithProtocol(java.lang.String input)
        Check if the provided String start with one supported protocol strings.
        Parameters:
        input - the String to check.
        Returns:
        true if the String start with a protocol, else false.

      • startWithProtocol

        public static boolean startWithProtocol(java.lang.String input,
                                        java.lang.String protocol)
        Check if the provided String start with a specified protocol String.
        Parameters:
        input - the String to check.
        protocol - the protocol String.
        Returns:
        true if the String start with the specified protocol, else false.

      • countStringOccur

                                   java.lang.String word)
        Counts the number of occurences of a given String into another
        Parameters:
        text - the String to look in
        word - the String to be found into the text
        Returns:
        the number of occurences of the word

      • stringSplitter

        public static java.lang.String[] stringSplitter(java.lang.String text,
                                                java.lang.String pattern)
        Returns a list of strings from a single String splitted given a pattern (must end with pattern)
        Parameters:
        text - the String to split into multiple Strings
        pattern - the String separating each substring
        Returns:
        the list of substrings
